title: Last Whisper Items are Essentially better than Lethality for Assassins(in terms of dmg) check it out
body:
{{item:3033}}  50 AD 35% **Bonus armor pen** and Grievous Wounds for 5s
{{item:3142}} 60 AD (soon 55) 15 Lethality.

So we all know that Bonus Arm Pen is items/runes/masteries and Lethality is 60% value up front 40% based on enemy level..

I'm not going to super number crunch this but for a small example lets say an ADC buys {{item:3047}} 30 armor, and has 9x armor yellows............... **39 Bonus Armor**
{{item:3033}}  39(.35) = 13.65 Armor Pen
{{item:3142}}  Flat Armor Penetration = LETHALITY × (0.6 + 0.4 × Target's level ÷ 18) Correct me if i'm wrong, havn't done this formula in awhile, 9 flat upfront pen, and if the target is say level 10, thats roughly 3 more arm pen, total, 12 Armor pen.

Even if they didn't get Tabis, Maybe they get a GA.. Same thing.. What if they have Tabi + GA..  you get 24 Armor Pen from {{item:3033}} 

Obviously Lethality items offer other things outside of damage, but the anit-healing on {{item:3033}}  is probably being undervalued for assassins..

Basically what i'm trying to get at is.. Why is Riot making all the lethality items 55 AD as if the 15 Lethality is suppose to make up for the lack of ad.. When Assassins could just keep opting for {{item:3812}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3026}} and be more durable while having just as much if not more damage.. And if they really needed a Pen item then {{item:3033}}  is imo a better option to fill that need.

replies.body: Lethality items are better against people with no armor and last whisper is better against people with armor.

Well duh. But what i'm saying even vs just Tabis the LW item is going to do more damage for most of the game. And if you get the anti-healing it'll probably go even further than the lethality items.. Again, this isn't discrediting the other actives/passives on the Lethality items, but in terms of cutting through an ADC.. Mortal Reminder should be considered WAY more esp after these AD nerfs to lethality.
you can build both.

Last Whisper is bettter _than Lethality_ against people with armor.

What you are negelcting to treat here, though, is that lethality can stack, and % penetration can't. It SHOULD be that the one armor pen item is more effective than ONE lethality item against someone with ANY armor. That changes as soon as you factor in the rest of the builds, though.

I don't do a lot of math crunch, but compare Mortal Reminder + Infinity Edge against Duskblade + Ghostblade against the same hypothetical foe. Let me know if I'm wrong.

What.. Sure u can stack lethality, I get that, but im saying if ur trying to get thru an adc who had tabis or ga, mortal reminder wins out.. Then only time full lethality is better is if they have zero armor items, and only runes..

And dont u think its a little oppressive that an adc can so easily counter an assassins items with little to no trade offs?

Lethality builds need more than 20 lethality to function. If ALL you build is 20 lethality, yeah, you're going to suck. That's a given. Riot knows that and that's intended. 

Again, calculate full build, and let me know if you aren't more effective against  GA + tabis than one % armor pen item. THAT would be a problem. Your one item hypothetical doesn't represent a realistic situation in game; you don't just build what's best at 15 minutes, you have to consider where that build is going.

I can tell u right now that mortal reminder would fill as a better item slot than a 3rd lethality item.. Thats a no brainer. Lets also take into account how little gold needs to be invested and little build path changing is needed to counter an ad assassin these days..

It's a no brainer if you want to kill people with LOTS of armor. That's the point. Third lethality item helps more against squishy targets.

I mean, if that's what you're building in game on AD assassins, I would fully expect you to think they are easy to counter. If you made an AD carry build ninja tabi and a GA before they get I edge and a crit/atk speed item, you did your job well. They are a less effective carry as a result, and they haven't actually stopped you from being able to kill them (in balanced cases, let's leave Draven out of this).

I'm just trying to help. You argument seemed to be asking someone to explain why you should build lethality, and I'm trying to do that. You're welcome to do the math to confirm or refute, but that's what I would need to see to change my mind. 60 lethality is VERY good against carries. I don't see a way around that.

Well yeah 60 Lethality isn't bad vs carries, i'm saying i could opt for 1 or 2 lethality items and get a {{item:3033}}  instead of a 3rd lethality item and have better results.. There is no scaling lethality item now, other than the 40% that is based on champion level which is tied into all the items..

It seems like a good choice to me. I want both of those things to be viable on AD assassins, based on their goals. If they want to help bust the tanks, % pen should be viable. But if it's ever objectively better to ALWAYS have % pen, that's a problem. I at least agree with you on that; I'm not convinced that's the case right now, but if it were, it would be problematic.

(sidenote: note sure why people are downvoting you. I think this is a good discussion we're having)

You kind of devalued the 5 extra ad and the active on ghostblade,  but the point still stands that lethality is garbo against any cloth armor item.

I didny devalue anything, I focused on the point which was lethality vs bonus armor pen. I didnt go into actives and passives too much because those values change depending on the champs and the game. But the value of pen is a more independent variable for this.

Damage with lw item and 150 ad vs 39 armor = ~119 damage

Damage with Youmuu's vs lvl 10 and 155 ad vs 39 armor = ~122 damage

Damage with lw item and 250 ad vs 39 armor = ~198

Damage with Youmuu's vs lvl 10 and 255 ad vs 39 armor = ~200

Damage with lw item and 150 ad vs 69 armor = ~104

Damage with Youmuu's vs lvl 18 and 150 = ~100

Even if the adc picked up a GA the assassin loses 4% damage due to that 5 ad making up some ground. Ergo you devalued the item based on its pen stat when its ad stat picks up the difference pretty well. This is true vs tabi armor seals always.

Yeah it is really close for sure and I do think heal reduction in the current meta is worth its weight in gold. As is though Youmuu's can stand up by itself, but in 2 item powerspikes Mortal Reminder starts to pummel it by a good 10 damage even against just tabi. Against 2 armor items it gets significantly outclassed pretty quickly, I'd be willing to say the small powerspike on Youmuus isn't worth building it next patch. Duskblade with a Mortal Reminder will be a much better early and mid game spike with better stats for less gold.

Two things.

One, with Runes Reforged, people won't be able to opt into Armor through Runes anymore, and compensation for that will largely be given to junglers for clearing (And likely in the form of camp damage nerfs instead of Armor buffs).

Two, Tabis being built on ADCs isn't because of Lethality, but because the offensive option is lacking. Berserker's Greaves should actually be buffed to make them a better buy for AS based characters than Tabi's are. Personally, I would make them have extra movement speed while in combat, probably something like +20, sorta like an opposite of Mobi Boots.

Uhhh no, Tabi's is being bought because it's just a good boot. It helps you duel other AA'er (aka, the other adc) and it mitigates  a lot of assassin's damage. ADC's in the past use to only get 1 attack speed item then they'd build AD.. (vayne/twitch being an exception of course) Now you generally get 2 attack speed items anyways so the beserkers arn't a must. YES you can get them, they're still good boots. But in terms of surviving which AD's tend to do these days.. Tabi's are a great option.

That in and of itself means that ADCs need a better offensive boot option, either in the form of Berserkers or a new boot.

ADCs shouldn't build defensives. If we solve that issue, Lethality's role falls into place.
No it means they get enough attack speed thru all the zeal items and other attack speed items that they can use, hense they dont need it on boots
Doesn't need to be an Attack Speed boot.
Exactly why they can afford tabis with very little tradeoffs

I think you're missing what I'm trying to say. I'm saying there needs to be a viable and desirable offensive boot option for ADCs so that they don't want to invest into Tabis. It doesn't need to be Attack Speed boots; it can bring other offensive power somehow. But if a new boot is introduced that ADCs would opt into, they would no longer build Tabis, you wouldn't need to nerf Tabi's for it's intended users, and Lethality would function against ADCs as intended.

I think the bigger problem is ADC's have far more options than any class.. Instead of just making some items melee only, they cater to ADCs by not doing so. Thus why an ADC item such as Mortal Reminder, is better than a 2nd Lethality item.. thats pretty sad.

You're not wrong. I agree that it's high time we make some items melee only, but I do understand Riot's reluctance; doing so forcibly crushes player creativity and has the potential of feeling a bit tyrannical. "Play the game how we say or else." Etc.

At this point, though, a certain number of items should at least have reduced benefits for ranged champions.
